page.title: 03Rempstone
page.content: { Rempstone}is a{street village}with a{ {population}of around{600.}It has an {old school}which closed down in{April {1983}because it only had 8 children and 2 teachers. { All Saints Church}was built in 1774 using the bricks from the original church. Rempstone has a{Manor}and an{Old {Rectory}on{Main Street}and the{Holy {Cross Convent}near to{Stanford Hall, but even so Rempstone has no shops. Over the years Rempstone has had many names,in 1086{Rampestune,}also{ {Rapestone,Repestone}and{Rempstow,}and in 1579{Rampstone}and{Ramston. Rempstone is a commuter village where most of the inhabitants travel to Loughborough,Leicester or Nottingham to work.
